intro: Hebeclinium brevipetiolatum, commonly known as the short-petioled hebeclinium, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy blue or violet flowers. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves with short petioles, giving it a compact appearance. It typically thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Hebeclinium brevipetiolatum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
